docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Paul D. Ryan, the Republican chairman of the House Budget Committee, has been excoriated by some Roman Catholic leaders ever since he claimed this month that his budget plan, which slashes antipoverty programs, was inspired by the moral teachings of his Catholic faith.

headline.main: Georgetown Faculty Latest to Chide Ryan

docs.abstract: Nearly 90 faculty members and priests at Georgetown sign a letter of protest before Paul Ryan is to deliver a lecture there on Thursday.
docs.snippet: Nearly 90 faculty members and priests at Georgetown sign a letter of protest before Paul Ryan is to deliver a lecture there on Thursday.

headline.main: When $2,600 in Premiums Yields $1.7 Million in Claims

docs.abstract: The largest open claim under a long-term care insurance policy in 2011 was $1.7 million, an industry group reports.
docs.snippet: The largest open claim under a long-term care insurance policy in 2011 was $1.7 million, an industry group reports.

docs.abstract: A summary of what's on today's editorial page.
docs.snippet: A summary of what's on today's editorial page.

headline.main: Insurer Details Higher Risks for Drivers After Deployment

docs.abstract: A new study by USAA finds that troops are responsible for more automobile accidents after returning from Iraq and Afghanistan.
docs.snippet: A new study by USAA finds that troops are responsible for more automobile accidents after returning from Iraq and Afghanistan.

docs.lead_paragraph: The State Office for People With Developmental Disabilities cites a “fundamental conflict” that prevents it from exercising oversight and proposes to turnover much of its work to a non-profit group.

headline.seo: Report on State Agency Oversight of Vulnerable
headline.main: Report on State Agency Oversight of Vulnerable

docs.snippet: The State Office for People With Developmental Disabilities cites a “fundamental conflict” that prevents it from exercising oversight and proposes to turnover much of its work to a non-profit group.

docs.lead_paragraph: After compiling a database of customary rates for medical procedures, many insurance companies switched to a calculation based on Medicare rates, meaning higher costs for patients.

headline.seo: Health Insurers Switch Baseline for Out-of-Network Charges
headline.main: Insurers Alter Cost Formula, and Patients Pay More
headline.print_headline: Insurers Alter Cost Formula; Patients Pay

docs.abstract: Nation's largest health insurers have been switching to a new payment method that in most cases increases costs to the patient, despite landmark 2009 settlement with New York State that was expected to increase coverage for out-of-network care; though settlement required companies to underwrite a new database of customary doctors' fees with $95 million, it did not obligate them to use it; so companies nationwide rapidly shifted to another calculation method, based on Medicare rates, that usually reduces reimbursement substantially.
docs.snippet: After compiling a database of customary rates for medical procedures, many insurance companies switched to a calculation based on Medicare rates, meaning higher costs for patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Rathmann oversaw Amgen as it developed what would become two of the most successful drugs in history and became the world’s largest biotechnology company.

headline.seo: George Rathmann, Chief of Amgen, Dies at 84
headline.main: George Rathmann, Amgen Chief, Dies at 84
headline.print_headline: George Rathmann, Amgen Chief, Dies at 84

docs.abstract: George B Rathmann, who was the first chief executive of Amgen and helped build it into the world’s largest biotechnology company, dies at age 84.
docs.snippet: Dr. Rathmann oversaw Amgen as it developed what would become two of the most successful drugs in history and became the world’s largest biotechnology company.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Nebraska Legislature has sent the message that promoting healthy pregnancies is more important than fretting over a woman’s immigration status.
docs.abstract: Editorial praises the Nebraska Legislature for overriding Gov Dave Heineman's veto of a bill to provide free prenatal care to undocumented immigrant women; notes that result was brought about by an unlikely alliance between women's health advocates and anti-abortion groups who feel that unborn children do not yet have an immigration status.
docs.snippet: The Nebraska Legislature has sent the message that promoting healthy pregnancies is more important than fretting over a woman’s immigration status.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans are proposing to take tens of billions out of programs for the poorest Americans so as not to make cuts in the Pentagon budget.
docs.abstract: Editorial warns that House Republicans are attempting to wriggle out of their agreement to force deep cuts in military spending by instead taking tens of billions of dollars out of programs for the poorest Americans; notes that the Senate and the White House have promised to reject any such cuts, again raising the specter of a legislative shutdown.
docs.snippet: Republicans are proposing to take tens of billions out of programs for the poorest Americans so as not to make cuts in the Pentagon budget.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration reported a significant deterioration in the financial outlook for Social Security, and that the financial condition of Medicare was stable but still unsustainable.

headline.seo: Financial Outlook Dims for Social Security

docs.abstract: Obama administration reports a significant deterioration in the outlook for Social Security, while stating that the financial condition of Medicare is stable but still unsustainable; the central message of government report is that the two programs will not last without structural changes that have so far eluded Congress and the administration.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration reported a significant deterioration in the financial outlook for Social Security, and that the financial condition of Medicare was stable but still unsustainable.
